body: Peaceful referendum in Southern Sudan comes to a close: "On the closing day of the elections the lines had all but vanished, wind whipped up dust that blew past the signs at almost empty polling stations. Rare were the southern Sudanese who had left their electoral duties for the last minute."
original_body: Peaceful referendum in Southern Sudan comes to a close: "On the closing day of the elections the lines had all but vanished, wind whipped up dust that blew past the signs at almost empty polling stations. Rare were the southern Sudanese who had left their electoral duties for the last minute."
title: Sudan: Peaceful referendum comes to a close

sentence: Peaceful referendum in Southern Sudan comes to a close: "On the closing day of the elections the lines had all but vanished, wind whipped up dust that blew past the signs at almost empty polling stations.
Rare were the southern Sudanese who had left their electoral duties for the last minute."
